meanings.definition: Having a sickly yellow or pale brown color.
meanings.sent1: The sallowy walls of the old house made it look eerie.
meanings.sent2: Her sallowy complexion indicated she was unwell.
meanings.sent3: The sallowy paint on the car made it seem like a ghost vehicle.
meanings.sent4: The sallowy sky foretold an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The sallowy light of the setting sun cast a melancholic hue over the landscape.

meanings.definition: Resembling the color of sallow skin.
meanings.sent1: The sallowy curtains in the room matched the pale tone of the patient's skin.
meanings.sent2: The artist used a sallowy shade to capture the essence of sallow skin in the portrait.
meanings.sent3: The sallowy paint on the fence made it blend in with the surrounding trees.
meanings.sent4: The sallowy leaves of the dying plant mirrored the sickly hue of sallow skin.
meanings.sent5: The sallowy glow of the moon gave the night an eerie feel.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of vitality or health.
meanings.sent1: His sallowy eyes betrayed his exhaustion.
meanings.sent2: The sallowy appearance of the neglected garden indicated a lack of care.
meanings.sent3: The sallowy light in the room made everyone look tired.
meanings.sent4: The sallowy atmosphere of the room drained the energy out of the guests.
meanings.sent5: The sallowy sound of the wind through the empty streets added to the desolate feeling.
